summary: This is a forwarded FBI email chain from August 2019 discussing investigative updates on the Epstein case, focusing on co-conspirators including Ghislaine Maxwell, victim interviews, and arrest strategy. It reveals internal coordination and pressure for daily updates due to high-level inquiries.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as one of four primary co-conspirators in the Epstein case. The FBI is in contact with her counsel and is assessing her strategic value, but not tracking her daily movements.

events.title: FBI internal strategy discussions on co-conspirators
events.description: The FBI team in New York is assessing four primary co-conspirators, with one cooperating. They are interviewing victims and working with counsel to prioritize arrests, but do not plan simultaneous arrests.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is identified as one of four primary co-conspirators in the Epstein investigation.
One of the four co-conspirators was cooperating with the FBI as of August 2019.
The FBI was actively interviewing and re-interviewing victims to gather information on the co-conspirators.
Internal pressure existed for daily investigative updates due to numerous high-level inquiries about the case.
The FBI considered a Material Witness warrant for Maxwell but deemed it potentially counterproductive at that strategic juncture.
